humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the largest tumor as 2.2 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the size of the invasive tumor is measured as 2.2 cm in greatest dimension (part 1, section C). Therefore, the T stage is T2, as T1 is for tumors up to 2 cm in size, T2 is for tumors between 2-5 cm, T3 is for tumors larger than 5 cm, and T4 is for tumors of any size with direct extension into the chest wall or skin. The Nottingham grade, receptor status, and lymph node involvement provided in the report are not used to determine the T stage.
